properties.name: eureka.client.fetch-registry
properties.description: Specifies whether the client should fetch the Eureka registry. If set to true, the client retrieves a list of all registered services from the Eureka server.

properties.name: spring.discovery.locator.lower-case-service-id
properties.description: Determines whether the service IDs in the routes created by the Discovery Locator should be converted to lowercase. Useful for consistent routing when service IDs are case-sensitive.

properties.name: eureka.instance.prefer-ip-address
properties.description: Indicates whether the instance should register with its IP address instead of its hostname. Useful in environments where hostname resolution is unreliable.

properties.name: eureka.instance.instance-id
properties.description: Defines the unique instance ID for the service registered in Eureka. Typically includes the application name, IP address, and port to ensure uniqueness.

properties.name: eureka.client.service-url.default-zone
properties.description: Specifies the default Eureka server URL(s) that the client will connect to for service registration and discovery. Typically formatted as a URL ending with '/eureka/'.

properties.name: eureka.client.register-with-eureka
properties.description: Specifies whether the client should register itself with the Eureka server. If set to true, the application becomes discoverable by other services.

properties.name: config.cache.reload.midnight
properties.description: Spring cache reload cron expression to schedule at midnight everyday

properties.name: config.cache.reload.hour
properties.description: Spring cache reload cron expression to schedule at evry hour everyday

properties.name: management.endpoints.web.base-path
properties.description: Path on which actuator services will be exposed

properties.name: management.stackdriver.metrics.export.enabled
properties.description: Property to determine the usage of stackdriver metrics

properties.name: config.kafka.enable-kafka
properties.description: Flag to switch on/off KAFKA integration
